citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee refused to allow USDA inspectors to conduct an inspection at approximately 1:59 PM. I spoke directly to the
licensee. My supervisor was also on speaker phone with the licensee. My supervisor and I both asked the licensee
multiple times if we could do an inspection. The licensee would not give us a straight answer. The licensee became vulgar
and belligerent with us during our conversation and after asking multiple times and not getting an answer, my supervisor
directed us to leave the site. Prior to the conversation escalating at the end of our visit, the licensee was informed of the
serious consequences of us not being allowed to conduct an inspection. I explained to the licensee the importance of us
being able to conduct an inspection.
Not allowing APHIS officials to conduct an inspection doesn't allow APHIS officials to ensure animal welfare standards are
being met. The licensee must allow APHIS officials to conduct an inspection when those officials show up to conduct an
inspection. Correct starting on 6/18/25.
No exit interview was conducted.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Shoshana Tanenbaum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.126(a)  Critical
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The licensee refused to allow USDA inspectors to conduct an inspection at approximately 1:59 PM. I spoke directly to the 
licensee. My supervisor was also on speaker phone with the licensee. My supervisor and I both asked the licensee 
multiple times if we could do an inspection. The licensee would not give us a straight answer. The licensee became vulgar 
and belligerent with us during our conversation and after asking multiple times and not getting an answer, my supervisor 
directed us to leave the site. Prior to the conversation escalating at the end of our visit, the licensee was informed of the 
serious consequences of us not being allowed to conduct an inspection. I explained to the licensee the importance of us 
being able to conduct an inspection. 
 
Not allowing APHIS officials to conduct an inspection doesn't allow APHIS officials to ensure animal welfare standards are 
being met. The licensee must allow APHIS officials to conduct an inspection when those officials show up to conduct an 
inspection. Correct starting on 6/18/25. 
 
No exit interview was conducted. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Shoshana Tanenbaum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
